item.title: Report E-2023060397
item.description:
Report E-2023060397

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: DERIDDER
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 1, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote of nickel sulfate (UN3082) was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer floor and concrete surface below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES&H services (ESH) to remediate the site. ESH personnel deployed granular absorbents and worked them in using hand tools as well as utilizing degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. The crew overpacked the damaged 275-gallon tote into one (1) 330-gallon tote and all nickel sulfate impacted material in five (5) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023060188
item.description:
Report X-2023060188

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-17
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The drum was loaded improperly on the shelf of the truck, the driver saw it was on the shelf, she said when she made a turn the drum slide and hit a corner on the shelf causing it to fall in the truck, when the driver tried to clean it up, some of it on her finger tips, began to burn, she stated she tried to wash it off with soap and water wasn't able to, went to the hospital. DescribePack: about oz spilled, the top slightly opened up on the drum when it fell off the shelf, enough to coat the rim of the drum DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: driver covered the package up with a plastic bag , truck was parked in a well ventilated area, cleaned out,the drum was placed in a hazmat tote in a ventilated area once it reached the station

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 5 gallon pails of paint (un1263) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 2 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

Report X-2023051123

  • State: LA

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found with a wet spot and a smell coming from package, Package was immediately placed inside a hazmat bin and brought to the hazmat cage for further inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection a loose cap was found and caused the acid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside hazmat bin to help stop the spread of the liquid.

item.title: Report E-2023050488
item.description:
Report E-2023050488

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-18
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the quality control inspection process for arriving drums to Veolia's 10-day intransit facility in Port Allen, LA, a small puddle of unknown liquid (approximately Â½ cup) was observed at the edge of a pallet. After informing the supervisor on duty, the pallet was pulled aside and inspected. One drum of waste was found with a pinhole leak ~3 inches from the edge of the bottom of the drum. The leak appeared to not be from stress or gradual wear, and it's believed that the drum may have been compromised during the generator's loading process or a manufacturing fault in the packaging exists since this is the second time an incident like this has occurred with this generator. The drum was overpacked into a salvage drum, and the spill was cleaned using oil dry.

item.title: Report E-2023050485
item.description:
Report E-2023050485

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-18
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSL experienced a UN2831 Methyl Chloroform release from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture impacting their dock floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed terminal personnel applied Oil Dri to the impacted area. Approximately 20-gallons of product released to a 20' x 30' area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Additional absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum containing approximately 35-gallons of product was placed into a 95-gallon poly over pack. The impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023050569
item.description:
Report X-2023050569

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-10
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Management notified QA about damaged hazmat leaking in trailer. Everyone was moved around from area until hazmat was moved to cage for inspection. DescribePack: After inspecting there was a small wet stain at the bottom of box once steel drum was removed. There was also a loose cap on drum that caused liquid to spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Everyone was moved from area until hazmat was placed into a red hazardous tote. Box was moved to cage for inspection by certified personnel.

item.title: Report E-2023050163
item.description:
Report E-2023050163

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tote was inspected by Veolia upon receipt from the customer and showed no signs of leaks or damage to the tote of any kind. However, it was noticed that the the closure on the tote was loose. The closure was tightened and secured before loading onto the truck. Upon arrival at Veolia's 10-Day facility in Port Allen, LA, saturation was noticed on the trailer floor. Upon further inspection, the tote was identified as having a significant size crack in the top corner of the container that was not present at the time of pickup. It is believed that the container failed during transit. Approximately 5 gallons of material was spilled.
